If at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), a further transformation \\( S[f](t) = \\int e^{-i\\omega's}f(s)ds \\) (where \\( \\omega' \\neq \\omega \\)) is applied as an intervention, will the outcome for \\( T[S[z]](t) \\) depend only on \\( \\omega \\) and not on \\( \\omega' \\)?
Explanation: The additional transformation \\( S \\) introduces another frequency component \\( \\omega' \\) into the original function \\( z(t) \\). Since the Fourier transform of exponential functions sensitive to frequency changes, the result of \\( T[S[z]](t) \\) will depend on both \\( \\omega \\) and \\( \\omega' \\), altering the overall integral transformation results significantly.
